availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Newton Richey in Hancock County, Kentucky, on July 25, 1839. Father of Phoebe Richey, Mary Richey, James W. Richey, Elizabeth Richey, Maranda Richie, Susan Malvina Richie, Davis Richie, and Kittie Richie. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 290A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 972.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States(1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 214B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hancock County, KY, July and August 1863, p. 19.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Hancock County Births, p. 4.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729.
"Hawesville," Owensboro Daily Messenger, April 8, 1900, p. 9.
